column4: Hey, my friend is running Jaunty with all updates installed. Up until now he hasn't had any problems with it, but today he tried accessing the music on his phone, an LG Rumor, via USB. He says that the computer doesn't even recognize the phone. Help?
Is there a /dev file made when the phone is plugged in?
not sure, where would I check?
probably in /dev righht?
You can look at /dev directly and also run "dmesg" before and after plugging the phone in.
thanks. I'll come back here with the out-put
Look at both places before and after you plug the phone in.
How's it going?
it's taking a while, we're doing this over IM
Are you in turn helping somebody else?  Why not just have that person get on the irc channels?
I'm working on getting him in here now, and also he says it created a file whenever he plugged the phone in
If the phone is a USB storage device it should create a file.  That is correct :)
so now what? He still can't access the phone
does it have a /dev  ?  What did dmesg say?  I'm just trying to find out if ubuntu sees the phone at all.
we've determined that it does create a /dev file whenever he plugs it in. He still hasn't run dmesg yet and I'm still trying to get him in here.
When he does get in here get him into a room with just him you and I
What is the dev file?  /dev/sdb1 or something?  When he puts files on the phone does he usually just drag and drop them into the folder the gnome makes??
how do I do that? Make a room, that is.
you just "/join #a room that doesn't already exist" to create a new room.  Then tell me and him the name you choose so we can "/join <room>"
the room is #edbian-apollo-mike
I'm there!
